Plots

Author

Arvind V

Published

December 14, 2023

Load libraries

library(palmerpenguins)
library(ggplot2)
ggplot2::theme_set(ggplot2::theme_minimal())
penguins <- na.omit(penguins)

ggplot2

Credit to Alison Hill + Allison Horst

```{r}
mass_flipper <- ggplot(data = penguins, 
                       aes(x = flipper_length_mm,
                           y = body_mass_g)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = species, 
                 shape = species),
             size = 3,
             alpha = 0.8) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("darkorange","purple","cyan4")) +
  labs(title = "Penguin size, Palmer Station LTER",
       subtitle = "Flipper length and body mass for Adelie, Chinstrap and Gentoo Penguins",
       x = "Flipper length (mm)",
       y = "Body mass (g)",
       color = "Penguin species",
       shape = "Penguin species") +
  theme(legend.position = c(0.2, 0.7),
        plot.title.position = "plot",
        plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0, face= "italic"),
        plot.caption.position = "plot",
        plot.background = element_rect(color = "black"))
```

Basic plot

```{r}
mass_flipper
```

Basic plot

Increasing the width/DPI only affects the scaling of the image, it will not overflow.

```{r}
#| fig-width: 10
#| fig-height: 4
#| fig-dpi: 600
mass_flipper
```

Aside

The palmerpenguins R package contains two datasets that we believe are a viable alternative to Anderson’s Iris data (see datasets::iris). In this introductory vignette, we’ll highlight some of the properties of these datasets that make them useful for statistics and data science education, as well as software documentation and testing.

Overflow Content

There are many options for overflow, either left/right

```{r}
#| column: body-outset-right
#| fig-width: 10
mass_flipper
```

```{r}
#| column: screen-inset-right
#| fig-width: 10
mass_flipper
```

```{r}
#| column: page-inset-left
#| fig-width: 10
mass_flipper
```

```{r}
#| column: screen-left
#| fig-width: 10
mass_flipper
```
